traceability.evidence:
Previous assessment: FAILED The project contains a `src/maintenance` folder with TypeScript modules (detect.ts, update.ts, batch.ts, report.ts, utils.ts) and corresponding Jest tests covering: • REQ-MAINT-DETECT (detectStaleAnnotations + tests) • REQ-MAINT-UPDATE (updateAnnotationReferences + tests) • REQ-MAINT-BATCH & REQ-MAINT-VERIFY (batchUpdateAnnotations, verifyAnnotations + basic tests) • REQ-MAINT-REPORT (generateMaintenanceReport + tests)
However, the following acceptance criteria and requirements are not addressed or missing: • No CLI entrypoint or command‐line scripts to invoke maintenance tools (“Core Functionality” was implemented as APIs only, not as CLI tools). • No documentation (README updates, usage examples, best practices) for how to run or configure the maintenance helpers. • No user‐experience feedback: the APIs return counts/arrays/strings but do not log or report what changed in a user‐friendly way. • No support for reversibility (REQ-MAINT-SAFE): there is no mechanism to undo or rollback updates, no backups, no transactional safety. • Error handling is incomplete: permission errors bubble unhandled, no handling of circular story‐reference scenarios or detailed error messages. • Integration with existing ESLint plugin infrastructure is not demonstrated or tested.
Because key acceptance criteria around CLI integration, user feedback, documentation, safe/undoable operations, and integration are unimplemented, the story is not fully satisfied.
